result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kathleen M Cashin

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: from VIP Program Director dated 03/15/17 in re:  request to successfully discharge the defendant from the VIP program effective immediately

Defendant Kathleen M Cashin in court with attorney Peter Christopher Lloyd. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Program director is also present.
Cases heard at this time are 16CM-59 and 16CM-58.

8:35 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea and sentencing today.

Court has a signed Plea questionnaire/Agreement.

There is a plea agreement.

Atty Constable moves to dismiss and read in 16CM-59.
Defendant will plead to 16CM-58.
Defendant has been assess for VIP program and is recommended to receive the program.

Court has received a copy of the assessment.
Parties are asking the Court to adopt the recommendation.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Defendant has filed a check in the amount of $286.60, with the DA's office for the amount of the restitution.

Atty Lloyd concurs.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 16CM-58.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Lloyd for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to WITHHOLD entry Judgment of Conviction this date.
16CM-58: Found Guilty
16CM-59: Dismissed and Read In

Atty Lloyd makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing, will adopt the recommendations.

BY THE COURT:
16CM-58:
Count 1:
VIP Program for a period of 9 Months
Conditions:
Perform 25 hours of community service
Complete a 4 hour online shoplifting prevention class
Participate in other community based services as determined appropriate by the VIP program director
Full restitution has been paid
Plea/sentencing hearing on June 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt: Status conference on May 23, 2016 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Kathleen M Cashin in court with attorney Peter Christopher Lloyd. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 16CM58 and 16CM59.

1:48 p.m.  Court calls case and states the appearances.

Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Atty Lloyd enters NG pleas on his clients behalf 

16CM58 $500 signature bond and not be on Fleet Farm Store in Stevens Point to be applied to both files.

BY THE COURT:
$500 signature bond and applies to both cases.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 14, 2016 at 08:30 am.
